query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Ne l’ora che non può ’l calor dïurno 2 intepidar più ’l freddo de la luna, 3 vinto da terra, e talor da Saturno

query.result: 1 Yn termyn na alloes tommder an dedh 2 tommhegi moy an yenner an loor, 3 drehevys gans an nor ha Saturn whiles,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.result: 4 —pan welo an jeomantoryon aga Fortyn Meur 5 yn est, kyns an gwawr, 6 ow tos ow kul ow talleth bys rudh—,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 mi venne in sogno una femmina balba, 8 ne li occhi guercia, e sovra i piè distorta, 9 con le man monche, e di colore scialba.

query.result: 7 deuth dhe'm yn hunros benyn balb, 8 ow skevens yn aga lagha ha kemmys ow troha, 9 ow dhewlyn tronk ha ow liw glas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Io la mirava; e come ’l sol conforta 11 le fredde membra che la notte aggrava, 12 così lo sguardo mio le facea scorta
query.error: **English:** 10 I looked at her; and as the sun comforts 11 the cold limbs that the night weighs down, 12 so my gaze made her tongue swift,
query.result: 10 Yth omwelis; ha kepar ha’n howl a wraga 11 an esel oos ow teves an nos, 12 hemma hemma ow fakya an golon aga tavos

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 la lingua, e poscia tutta la drizzava 14 in poco d’ora, e lo smarrito volto, 15 com’ amor vuol, così le colorava.
query.error: **English:** 13 and then straightened her whole body 14 in a short time, and her lost color, 15 as love wills, returned to her face.
query.result: 13 ha wosa hemma ow tosya aga hol korf, 14 yn skon termyn byghan, ha aga enep kollet, 15 kepar ha kar Amor, hemma hemma ow livya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Poi ch’ell’ avea ’l parlar così disciolto, 17 cominciava a cantar sì, che con pena 18 da lei avrei mio intento rivolto.
query.error: **English:** 16 After she had thus loosened her speech, 17 she began to sing so sweetly that with difficulty 18 I would have turned my attention away from her.
query.result: 16 Wosa hemma ow tosya aga lavar kepar henna, 17 hemma a dhalleth kanna kepar henna, byttegen 18 owth omma trohya an golon aga entent.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 «Io son», cantava, «io son dolce serena, 20 che ’ marinari in mezzo mar dismago; 21 tanto son di piacere a sentir piena!
query.error: **English:** 19 "I am," she sang, "I am the sweet siren 20 who bewilders sailors in the middle of the sea; 21 so full am I of pleasure to hear!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Io volsi Ulisse del suo cammin vago 23 al canto mio; e qual meco s’ausa, 24 rado sen parte; sì tutto l’appago!».
query.error: **English:** 22 I turned Ulysses from his wandering course 23 with my song; and whoever dares to be with me, 24 rarely leaves me; so completely do I satisfy him!"
query.result: 22 My a drohya Ulises a'y fordh vagas 23 dhe'm kanna; ha neb a wraga gansam, 24 kov a wraga yma; hemma hemma ow'n gorra!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Ancor non era sua bocca richiusa, 26 quand’ una donna apparve santa e presta 27 lunghesso me per far colei confusa.
query.error: **English:** 25 Her mouth was not yet closed, 26 when a holy and ready woman appeared 27 beside me to confound her.
query.result: 25 Nyns o aga geno kosel, 26 pan dheuth benyn sans ha prest 27 dhe'm dhe wul an wraga henna kovfus.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 «O Virgilio, Virgilio, chi è questa?», 29 fieramente dicea; ed el venìa 30 con li occhi fitti pur in quella onesta.
query.error: **English:** 28 "O Virgil, Virgil, who is this?", 29 she said fiercely; and he came 30 with his eyes fixed only on that virtuous woman.
query.result: 28 "O Virgili, Virgili, piw yw henna?", 29 hemma a leveris yn feers; ha henna a dheuth 30 gans aga lagha set yn unnik yn henna onest.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 L’altra prendea, e dinanzi l’apria 32 fendendo i drappi, e mostravami ’l ventre; 33 quel mi svegliò col puzzo che n’uscia.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.error: **English:** 34 I moved my eyes, and the good master: "At least three 35 times I have called you!", he said, "Get up and come; 36 let us find the opening through which you may enter".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.result: 37 Y'm sevel, ha pub tra o an leun 38 gans an jydh ughel an menydh sans, 39 ha nyn o kerdhes gans an howl nowydh dhe'n kolon.

query.prompt:

100 Intra Sïestri e Chiaveri s’adima 101 una fiumana bella, e del suo nome 102 lo titol del mio sangue fa sua cima.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Un mese e poco più prova’ io come 104 pesa il gran manto a chi dal fango il guarda, 105 che piuma sembran tutte l’altre some.

query.result: 103 Mis ha byghan moy provyas vy efan 104 pyw an mantell bras dhe'n neb a'n gwyl a'n fank, 105 rag pluv semlant oll an aremmow erel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 La mia conversïone, omè!, fu tarda; 107 ma, come fatto fui roman pastore, 108 così scopersi la vita bugiarda.
query.error: **English:** 106 My conversion, alas!, was late; 107 but, as soon as I became the Roman shepherd, 108 I discovered the deceitful life.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Vidi che lì non s’acquetava il core, 110 né più salir potiesi in quella vita; 111 per che di questa in me s’accese amore.
query.error: **English:** 109 I saw that the heart was not at peace there, 110 nor could it rise any higher in that life; 111 therefore love for this life was kindled in me.

query.prompt:

112 Fino a quel punto misera e partita 113 da Dio anima fui, del tutto avara; 114 or, come vedi, qui ne son punita.

query.prompt:

query.result: 118 Dell yw an lagha ni a wra asergis 119 yn uhel, fisys dhe'n traowow tyryel, 120 dell yw justitia yma war an nor a'n mergis.

query.result: 130 "Pyth achos," ef a leveris, "a'th torris dell vel?" 131 Ha my dhe ef: "Rag an agas dignitas 132 ow cosciens a'm remorjis yn iredh."

136 Se mai quel santo evangelico suono 137 che dice ‘Neque nubent’ intendesti, 138 ben puoi veder perch’ io così ragiono.
